availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Lawrence County, Kentucky, farmhand and soldier. Kentucky native. Farmhand in Lawrence County in 1860. Officer and First Lieutenant in the 14th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.), from 1861 to 1863.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, p. 77. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, Louisa, p. 27. Case Files of Approved Pension Applications of Widows and Other Veterans of the Army and Navy Who Served Mainly in the Civil War and the War with Spain, compiled 1861-1934, Fold3, application no. WC141734. Historical Data Systems, comp., U.S. Civil War Soldiers and Profiles, 1861-1865. Find A Grave, “G. R. B. Chapman (1830-1905),” Memorial #132168650, http://findagrave.com/memorial/132168650 (accessed February 15, 2018).
